subject: Re: [junit] Runner for non static inner class in JUnit 4.x

JDave is cool.  I'm not 100% clear what you want to do, and I don't see the
patch.  Could you perhaps include a small test case as inline text?

   David Saff

On Tue, Dec 30, 2008 at 10:27 AM, tuomaskarkkainenri <
tuomaskarkkainenri@...> wrote:

>   I participate in JDave (http://jdave.org). A BDD framework for Java
> that takes advantage of JUnit for example for Eclipse integration.
>
> We have tests in non-static inner classes of our test classes. These
> run wonderfully using the @RunWith annotation and our own runner.
>
> however, for individual tests, this doesn't work. What I would like
> to do is that AllDefaultPossibilitiesBuilder would check whether or
> not the test class is a non static member class. if it is, then I
> would grab the runner of the declaring class instead.
>
> I made a patch implementing this. I will try to attach it.
>
>  
>


[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
